item.title: 华尔街的中国计划在经历多年挫折和特朗普的紧张局势后摇摇欲坠。
item.description:
各大银行在重新思考发展战略的同时，也在减少投资和裁员。【原文：

Los principales bancos están reduciendo sus inversiones y recortando puestos de trabajo mientras replantean sus estrategias de crecimiento.

item.title: 中国呼吁加强联合国，借美国动荡之机采取行动
item.description: 面对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推出广泛的关税措施并切断美国与这一世界机构的一些联系的举动，中国政府正寻求施加更大的全球影响力。【原文：China’s top diplomat said no country can “go it alone” and called for a stronger UN, as Beijing seeks to exert more global influence in the face of President Donald Trump’s move to roll out broad-based tariffs and sever some US ties to the world body.】

item.title: 食糖贸易商要求交易所制定更严格的交货延迟规则
item.description: 全球大宗商品交易商正在推进可能的规则改革，旨在保护通过纽约一家主要交易所出售的糖的买家。【原文：Global commodities traders are moving forward with possible rule changes aimed at protecting sugar buyers on deliveries sold through a major New York exchange.】

item.title: 外汇波动导致全球企业通过期权和长期套期保值寻求庇护
item.description: 受去年汇率波动影响的全球企业正在认真对待利润受到的冲击，并反过来修改其套期保值策略。【原文：Global companies battered by last year’s currency swings are taking the profit hits to heart and revamping their hedging strategies in turn.】

item.title: 银湖公司收购英特尔公司 Altera 部门股份的交易即将达成
item.description: 知情人士透露，银湖管理公司（Silver Lake Management）正在就收购英特尔公司（Intel Corp.【原文：Silver Lake Management is in exclusive talks to acquire a majority stake in Intel Corp.’s programmable chips unit, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 卢旺达因刚果战争停止与比利时的发展合作
item.description: 卢旺达暂停了与比利时的发展合作，原因是比利时在刚果民主共和国东部冲突中的作用问题上存在分歧，试图 "破坏 "卢旺达获得资金的机会。【原文：Rwanda suspended development cooperation with Belgium for trying to “sabotage” its access to financing amid disagreements over its role in the conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.】

item.title: MMA称，特朗普对联邦紧急事务管理局援助的回扣给市政债券带来风险
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普总统试图通过扣留联邦资金来影响州和地方政策，市政债券投资者被建议缩减从美国政府获得大笔资金的信贷头寸。【原文：Municipal bond investors are being advised to scale back positions in credits that receive significant sums of money from the US government, as President Donald Trump seeks to affect state and local policy by withholding federal funding.】

item.title: 乌克兰考虑下一季进口天然气以支撑枯竭的储气库
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）讨论为这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家达成和平协议（其中可能包括燃料贸易协议）的同时，乌克兰正在考虑进口更多天然气，以填补其枯竭的储存缺口。【原文：Ukraine is considering more natural gas imports to fill the gap in its depleted storage, while Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin discuss a peace deal — which could include an agreement on fuel trade — for the war-torn country.】

item.description:

item.title: 阿根廷丑闻引发最受欢迎的 Memecoin 平台大跌
item.description: 索拉纳加密货币跌至 11 月初以来的最低水平，原因是阿根廷总统卷入了一桩丑闻，该丑闻涉及在索拉纳加密货币区块链上推出的一种 memecoin。【原文：The Solana cryptocurrency sank to the lowest level since early November as the president of Argentina became embroiled in a scandal involving a memecoin launched on the token’s blockchain.】

item.title: 赖特森称，黄金重估有可能给美联储带来 "混乱 "结果
item.description: Wrightson ICAP认为，在债务上限的限制下，重新估价美国的黄金储备可能看起来很诱人，但这将对金融体系产生深远影响，促进流动性并延长美联储资产负债表放松的时间。【原文：Revaluing the US gold stockpiles might look tempting under debt-ceiling constraints, but it would have far-reaching implications for the financial system, boosting liquidity and prolonging the Federal Reserve’s balance-sheet unwind, according to Wrightson ICAP.】

item.title: 联邦抵押贷款保险公司将裁员近半
item.description: 据两位熟悉该机构计划的消息人士透露，特朗普政府正计划解雇至少 40% 的联邦机构员工，该机构负责为那些没有资格获得贷款的人提供抵押贷款保险。【原文：The Trump administration is planning to lay off at least 40% of the workers at the federal agency that provides mortgage insurance on loans for people who otherwise wouldn’t qualify for one, according to two sources familiar with the agency’s plans.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州由政府资助的特许学校将关闭，面临 2,500 万美元债务风险
item.description: 圣安东尼奥的一所特许学校预计将于今年年底关闭，这将危及该机构三年前刚刚借入的 2500 万美元市政债券。【原文：A charter school in San Antonio is expected to close at the end of the year, jeopardizing $25 million of municipal bonds the institution borrowed just three years ago.】

item.title: 航运公司所有者在阿曼首次公开募股中寻求高达 3.33 亿美元的资金
item.description: 由阿曼主权财富基金支持的一家企业集团将从其航运业务的首次公开募股中筹集高达 1.281 亿阿曼里亚尔（3.327 亿美元）的资金。【原文：A conglomerate backed by Oman’s sovereign wealth fund is set to raise as much as OMR128.1 million ($332.7 million) from the initial public offering of its shipping business.】

item.title: 美联储主席迈克尔-巴尔称人工智能的速度会带来大规模风险
item.description: 美联储负责监管事务的副主席迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）说，人工智能具有吸引力的属性也同样会带来风险，其速度和自动性会在大范围内产生新的问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michael Barr said the attributes that make artificial intelligence attractive are the same ones that present risk, with speed and automaticity generating new issues at a wide scale.】

item.title: 据称布鲁克菲尔德酝酿向春季教育投资 10 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）正在洽谈向私立学校运营商斯普林教育集团（Spring Education Group）投资约 10 亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management is in talks to make a roughly $1 billion investment in private school operator Spring Education Group, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.description: 加密货币托管公司BitGo公司在计划上市的同时，还推出了一个全球数字资产场外交易平台。【原文：Crypto custody firm BitGo Inc. has launched a global over-the-counter trading desk for digital assets amid its plan to go public.】

item.title: Venture Global 分析师认为液化天然气公司上市乏力后股价走低
item.description: 许多帮助 Venture Global 公司上市的银行现在都认为，这家液化天然气出口商的股价比其已经缩水的上市计划更加低迷。【原文：Many of the banks that helped Venture Global Inc. go public now see the liquefied natural gas exporter’s stock price languishing even more from its already scaled back launch.】

item.title: Engie 称欧洲 80% 的天然气库存足以应对明年冬季需求
item.description: 据法国 Engie SA 公司称，即使官方略微放宽对天然气储备的要求，欧洲也应该有足够的天然气供应下一个冬季。【原文：Europe should have enough natural gas for next winter even if officials slightly relax requirements for reserves, according to France’s Engie SA.】

item.title: 欧洲央行延长允许远程工作时间约一半的规定
item.description: 欧洲中央银行延长了允许员工每年远程工作 110 天（约一半时间）的制度。【原文：The European Central Bank extended a regime under which staff is allowed to work remotely for 110 days — about half the time — each year.】

item.title: 特朗普反垄断执法者将保留拜登时代的兼并审查规则
item.description: 特朗普政府的反垄断执法者将沿用拜登时代的兼并审查规则，这让批评者大失所望，他们曾希望取消这些要求。【原文：The Trump administration’s antitrust enforcers will follow Biden-era merger review rules, disappointing critics who had hoped for a rollback of the requirements.】

item.title: Lyft获得唯一卖出评级，Arete因优步竞争下调其股票评级
item.description: 一位已成为该股唯一看跌者的分析师称，Lyft 公司面临的来自竞争对手优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：The intense competition Lyft Inc. faces from rival Uber Technologies Inc. is threatening to pressure its margins, according to one analyst who has become the lone bear on the stock.】

item.title: Tether 联合创始人正在开发可产生收益的稳定币竞争对手
item.description: Tether 的创始人之一正在支持一个新的稳定币项目，该项目将与世界上交易量最大的加密货币竞争。【原文：One of the original founders of Tether is backing a new stablecoin project — one that will compete with the world’s most traded cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 戴利说，美联储在通胀下降前应采取限制性政策
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，在通胀问题取得更多进展之前，政策需要保持限制性，她预计通胀将随着时间推移继续下降。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said policy needs to remain restrictive until there’s more progress on inflation, which she expects will continue declining over time.】

item.title: 首次公开募股首日交易失败威胁下一波美国上市潮
item.description: 华尔街最喜欢完美编排的首次公开募股（IPO），在交易前会发行更多股票并提高价格，以显示需求上升。高潮时，新上市公司股票在首个交易日大涨，为市场上更多被炒得沸沸扬扬的首次公开募股做好准备。【原文：Wall Street loves a perfectly choreographed IPO, with more shares offered and prices increased in the lead-up to the deal, to signal rising demand. At the climax, shares of newly-listed companies pop on their first trading day, priming the market for even more hyped-up debuts.】

item.title: 英特尔股价因解体猜测创 2023 年以来最大涨幅
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）涨幅高达 11%，原因是有人猜测，在台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Intel Corp. gained as much as 11% on speculation that the iconic chipmaker could be broken up in a deal involving Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and Broadcom Inc.】

item.title: 卡塔尔计划在印度投资 100 亿美元深化两国关系
item.description: 卡塔尔将在印度投资 100 亿美元，其主权基金也将在这个南亚国家开设办事处，以深化两国的双边关系。【原文：Qatar will invest $10 billion in India as well as have its sovereign fund open an office in the South Asian nation as the two countries seek to deepen bi-lateral ties.】

item.title: 受关税成本影响，美国住宅建筑商信心降至五个月低点
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率居高不下以及对关税的担忧，美国房屋建筑商的信心在 2 月份降至唐纳德-特朗普总统上台前以来的最低点，这在很大程度上削弱了人们对新总统政府最初的乐观情绪。【原文：Confidence among US homebuilders dropped in February to the lowest since before President Donald Trump took office as high mortgage rates and concern over tariffs sapped much of initial optimism for the new presidential administration.】
